client_id.description: The client ID for authenticating with the cloud API.

client_secret.description: The client secret for authenticating with the cloud API.

endpoint.description: The endpoint URL for the cloud API.

organization_id.description: The unique identifier of the organization.

exponent.description: The exponent used to increase the backoff interval.

initial_interval.description: The initial interval for the backoff strategy.

max_elapsed_time.description: The maximum total time to spend on retries.

max_interval.description: The maximum interval for the backoff strategy.

retry_connection_errors.description: Whether to retry on connection errors.

stack_id.description: The unique identifier of the stack.

uri.description: The base URI of the stack API.

wait_module_duration.description: The duration to wait for the module to be ready before proceeding.

bucket.description: The bucket where the ledger data will be stored. If not provided, a default bucket will be used.

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the ledger, stored as key-value pairs. Advanced usage: See [Ledger Advanced Filtering](https://docs.formance.com/ledger/advanced/filtering) and [Ledger documentation](https://docs.formance.com/ledger/) for more information.

block.description: Resource for managing a Formance Ledger. For advanced usage and configuration, see the [Ledger documentation](https://docs.formance.com/ledger/).

config.description: The configuration for the payment connector. It must not contain sensitive information like API keys or secrets. Advanced usage: See [Payments Connectors documentation](https://docs.formance.com/payments/connectors/) for connector configuration options.

credentials.description: The credentials for the payment connector. This should include sensitive information like API keys, secrets, certificate, and must be handled securely. Advanced usage: See [Payments Connectors documentation](https://docs.formance.com/payments/connectors/) for connector security best practices.

id.description: The unique identifier of the payment connector.

block.description: Resource for managing Formance Payments Connectors. For advanced usage and configuration, see the [Payments Connectors documentation](https://docs.formance.com/payments/connectors/).

accounts_ids.description: The list of accounts IDs associated with the pool. For more information, see the [Payments documentation](https://docs.formance.com/payments/).

id.description: The unique identifier of the payments pool.

block.description: Resource for managing a Formance Payments Pool. For advanced usage and configuration, see the [Payments documentation](https://docs.formance.com/payments/).

created_at.description: The timestamp when the reconciliation policy was created.

id.description: The unique identifier of the reconciliation policy.

ledger_name.description: The name of the ledger associated with the reconciliation policy.

ledger_query.description: The ledger query used to filter transactions for reconciliation. It must be a valid JSON object representing a query Builder. Advanced usage: See [Ledger Advanced Filtering documentation](https://docs.formance.com/ledger/advanced/filtering) for more details.

payments_pool_id.description: The ID of the payments pool associated with the reconciliation policy.

block.description: Resource for managing a Formance Reconciliation Policy. For advanced usage and configuration, see the [Reconciliation documentation](https://docs.formance.com/reconciliation/).

endpoint.description: The endpoint to which webhooks will be sent.

event_types.description: The types of events that will trigger webhooks.

id.description: The unique identifier of the webhook configuration.

secret.description: The secret used to sign webhook payloads. If not provided, a secret will be generated by the API. Advanced usage: See [Webhooks documentation](https://docs.formance.com/webhooks/) for security best practices.

block.description: Resource for managing Formance Webhooks. For advanced usage and configuration, see the [Webhooks documentation](https://docs.formance.com/webhooks/).
